page.title: 01Allt nan sugh and Sallachy
page.content: At the entrance to the glen Ben Conchra 453 feet stands on the west of Loch Long and Beinn Mheadoin on the east. Both are covered with heather and bracken. the village of Allt nan sugh clings to the mountainside on the west. It consists of one croft raising sheep only and 8 houses, 3 lived in holiday homes and 2 semi-derelict. Most of the village is on Attadale Estate, the rest on Conchra land. Through a copse of mixed woodland and we have Sallachy with 17 houses, 7 of which are holiday homes. There are three crofts with some arable land on which corn, potatoes and grass are grown in rotation. Two houses take paying guests. There are also 5 caravans, 4 lived in permanently.
